Name: PREAMBLE
Name and territory of the Union.
ArtDesc: India, that is Bharat, shall be a union of states and the territory of India consists of that of the states, union territories specified in the First Schedule and other acquired territories.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States.
The States and the territories thereof shall be as specified in the First Schedule.
The territory of India shall comprise

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the territories of the States;
the Union territories specified in the First Schedule; and
such other territories as may be acquired.

Name: Admission or establishment of new States.
ArtDesc: Parliament may by law admit into the Union, or establish, new States on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit.

Name: Sikkim to be associated with the Union
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution

Name: Formation of new States and alteration of areas, boundaries or names of existing States.

Explanations.Explanation: In this article, in clauses (a) to (e), "State" includes a Union territory, but in the proviso, "State" does not include a Union territory.
The power conferred on Parliament by clause (a) includes the power to form a new State or Union territory by uniting a part of any State or Union territory to any other State or Union territory.

Name: Laws made under articles 2 and 3 to provide for the amendment of the First and the Fourth Schedules and supplemental, incidental and consequential matters.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Any law referred to in article 2 or article 3 shall contain such provisions for the amendment of the First Schedule and the Fourth Schedule as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of the law and may also contain such supplemental, incidental and consequential provisions (including provisions as to representation in Parliament and in the Legislature or Legislatures of the State or States affected by such law) as Parliament may deem necessary.
No such law as aforesaid shall be deemed to be an amendment of this Constitution for the purposes of article 368.

Name: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution.
ArtDesc:
At the commencement of this Constitution, every person who has his domicile in the territory of India and—
(a) who was born in the territory of India; or
(b) either of whose parents was born in the territory of India; or
(c) who has been ordinarily resident in the territory of India for not less than five years immediately preceding such commencement,
shall be a citizen of India.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons who have migrated to India from Pakistan.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in article 5, a person who has migrated to the territory of India from the territory now included in Pakistan shall be deemed to be a citizen of India at the commencement of this Constitution if—
(a) he or either of his parents or any of his grand-parents was born in India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935 (as originally enacted); and
(b) (i) in the case where such person has so migrated before the nineteenth day of July, 1948, he has been ordinarily resident in the territory of India since the date of his migration, or
(ii) in the case where such person has so migrated on or after the nineteenth day of July, 1948, he has been registered as a citizen of India by an officer appointed in that behalf by the Government of the Dominion of India on an application made by him therefor to such officer before the commencement of this Constitution in the form and manner prescribed by that Government:
Provided that no person shall be so registered unless he has been resident in the territory of India for at least six months immediately preceding the date of his application.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in articles 5 and 6, a person who has after the first day of March, 1947, migrated from the territory of India to the territory now included in Pakistan shall not be deemed to be a citizen of India:
Provided that nothing in this article shall apply to a person who, after having so migrated to the territory now included in Pakistan, has returned to the territory of India under a permit for resettlement or permanent return issued by or under the authority of any law and every such person shall for the purposes of clause (b) of article 6 be deemed to have migrated to the territory of India after the nineteenth day of July, 1948.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons of Indian origin residing outside India.
ArtDesc: Notwithstanding anything in article 5, any person who or either of whose parents or any of whose grandparents was born in India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935 (as originally enacted), and who is ordinarily residing in any country outside India as so defined shall be deemed to be a citizen of India if he has been registered as a citizen of India by the diplomatic or consular representative of India in the country where he is for the time being residing on an application made by him therefor to such diplomatic or consular representative, whether before or after the commencement of this Constitution, in the form and manner prescribed by the Government of the Dominion of India or the Government of India.

Name: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State not to be citizens.
ArtDesc: No person shall be a citizen of India by virtue of article 5, or be deemed to be a citizen of India by virtue of article 6 or article 8, if he has voluntarily acquired the citizenship of any foreign State.

Name: Continuance of the rights of citizenship.
ArtDesc: Every person who is or is deemed to be a citizen of India under any of the foregoing provisions of this Part shall, subject to the provisions of any law that may be made by Parliament, continue to be such citizen.

Name: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law.
ArtDesc: Nothing in the foregoing provisions of this Part shall derogate from the power of Parliament to make any provision with respect to the acquisition and termination of citizenship and all other matters relating to citizenship.

Name: Definition.
ArtDesc: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, "the State" includes the Government and Parliament of India and the Government and the Legislature of each of the States and all local or other authorities within the territory of India or under the control of the Government of India.

Name: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of the fundamental rights.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All laws in force in the territory of India immediately before the commencement of this Constitution, in so far as they are inconsistent with the provisions of this Part, shall, to the extent of such inconsistency, be void.
The State shall not make any law which takes away or abridges the rights conferred by this Part and any law made in contravention of this clause shall, to the extent of the contravention, be void.
In this article, unless the context otherwise requires,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: "law" includes any Ordinance, order, bye-law, rule, regulation, notification, custom or usage having in the territory of India the force of law;

"laws in force" includes laws passed or made by a Legislature or other competent authority in the territory of India before the commencement of this Constitution and not previously repealed, notwithstanding that any such law or any part thereof may not be then in operation either at all or in particular areas.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in this article shall apply to any amendment of this Constitution made under article 368.

Name: Equality before law.
ArtDesc: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.

Name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: The State shall not discriminate against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them.
No citizen shall, on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them, be subject to any disability, liability, restriction or condition with regard to—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: access to shops, public restaurants, hotels and places of public entertainment; or
the use of wells, tanks, bathing ghats, roads and places of public resort maintained wholly or partly out of State funds or dedicated to the use of the general public.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any special provision for women and children.

Nothing in this article or in clause (2) of article 29 shall prevent the State from making any special provision for the advancement of any socially and educationally backward classes of citizens or for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes

Nothing in this article or in sub-clause (g) of clause (1) of article 19 shall prevent the State from making any special provision, by law, for the advancement of any socially and educationally backward classes of citizens or for the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes in so far as such special provisions relate to their admission to educational institutions including private educational institutions, whether aided or unaided by the State, other than the minority educational institutions referred to in clause (1) of article 30.
Nothing in this article or sub-clause (g) of clause (1) of article 19 or clause (2) of article 29 shall prevent the State from making,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: any special provision for the advancement of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clauses (4) and (5); and

any special provision for the advancement of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clauses (4) and (5) in so far as such special provisions relate to their admission to educational institutions including private educational institutions, whether aided or unaided by the State, other than the minority educational institutions referred to in clause (1) of article 30, which in the case of reservation would be in addition to the existing reservations and subject to a maximum of ten per cent. of the total seats in each category.

Explanations.Explanation: For the purposes of this article and article 16, "economically weaker sections" shall be such as may be notified by the State from time to time on the basis of family income and other indicators of economic disadvantage.

Name: Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: There shall be equality of opportunity for all citizens in matters relating to employment or appointment to any office under the State.

No citizen shall, on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, descent, place of birth, residence or any of them, be ineligible for, or discriminated against in respect of, any employment or office under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent Parliament from making any law prescribing, in regard to a class or classes of employment or appointment to an office under the Government of, or any local or other authority within, a State or Union territory, any requirement as to residence within that State or Union territory prior to such employment or appointment.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for the reservation of appointments or posts in favour of any backward class of citizens which, in the opinion of the State, is not adequately represented in the services under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for reservation in matters of promotion, with consequential seniority, to any class or classes of posts in the services under the State in favour of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes which, in the opinion of the State, are not adequately represented in the services under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from considering any unfilled vacancies of a year which are reserved for being filled up in that year in accordance with any provision for reservation made under clause (4) or clause (4A) as a separate class of vacancies to be filled up in any succeeding year or years and such class of vacancies shall not be considered together with the vacancies of the year in which they are being filled up for determining the ceiling of fifty per cent. reservation on total number of vacancies of that year.

Nothing in this article shall affect the operation of any law which provides that the incumbent of an office in connection with the affairs of any religious or denominational institution or any member of the governing body thereof shall be a person professing a particular religion or belonging to a particular denomination.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for the reservation of appointments or posts in favour of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clause (4), in addition to the existing reservation and subject to a maximum of ten per cent. of the posts in each category.

Name: Abolition of Untouchability.
ArtDesc: "Untouchability" is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden. The enforcement of any disability arising out of “Untouchability” shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No title, not being a military or academic distinction, shall be conferred by the State.
No citizen of India shall accept any title from any foreign State.
No person who is not a citizen of India shall, while he holds any office of profit or trust under the State, accept without the consent of the President any title from any foreign State.
No person holding any office of profit or trust under the State shall, without the consent of the President, accept any present, emolument, or office of any kind from or under any foreign State.

Name: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All citizens shall have the right—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: to freedom of speech and expression;
to assemble peaceably and without arms;
to form associations or unions or co-operative societies;
to move freely throughout the territory of India;
to reside and settle in any part of the territory of India; and
to acquire, hold and dispose of property;
to practise any profession, or to carry on any occupation, trade or business

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in sub-clause (a) of clause (1) shall affect the operation of any existing law, or prevent the State from making any law, in so far as such law imposes reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India,] the security of the State, friendly relations with foreign States, public order, decency or morality, or in relation to contempt of court, defamation or incitement to an offence.

Nothing in sub-clause (b) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India or public order, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause.

Nothing in sub-clause (c) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India or public order or morality, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause.

Nothing in sub-clauses (d) and (e) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of any of the rights conferred by the said sub-clauses either in the interests of the general public or for the protection of the interests of any Scheduled Tribe.

Nothing in sub-clause (g) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the general public, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause, and, in particular, nothing in the said sub-clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it relates to, or prevent the State from making any law relating to,—
(i) the professional or technical qualifications necessary for practising any profession or carrying on any occupation, trade or business, or
(ii) the carrying on by the State, or by a corporation owned or controlled by the State, of any trade, business, industry or service, whether to the exclusion, complete or partial, of citizens or otherwise.

Name: Protection in respect of conviction for offences.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No person shall be convicted of any offence except for violation of a law in force at the time of the commission of the Act charged as an offence, nor be subjected to a penalty greater than that which might have been inflicted under the law in force at the time of the commission of the offence.
No person shall be prosecuted and punished for the same offence more than once.
No person accused of any offence shall be compelled to be a witness against himself.

Name: Protection of life and personal liberty.
ArtDesc: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

Name: Right to education.
ArtDesc: The State shall provide free and compulsory education to all children of the age of six to fourteen years in such manner as the State may, by law, determine.

Name: Protection against arrest and detention in certain cases.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No person who is arrested shall be detained in custody without being informed, as soon as may be, of the grounds for such arrest nor shall he be denied the right to consult, and to be defended by, a legal practitioner of his choice.

Every person who is arrested and detained in custody shall be produced before the nearest magistrate within a period of twenty-four hours of such arrest excluding the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to the court of the magistrate and no such person shall be detained in custody beyond the said period without the authority of a magistrate.
Nothing in clauses (1) and (2) shall apply—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: to any person who for the time being is an enemy alien; or
to any person who is arrested or detained under any law providing for preventive detention.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No law providing for preventive detention shall authorise the detention of a person for a longer period than three months unless—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc:
an Advisory Board consisting of persons who are, or have been, or are qualified to be appointed as, Judges of a High Court has reported before the expiration of the said period of three months that there is in its opinion sufficient cause for such detention:
Provided that nothing in this sub-clause shall authorise the detention of any person beyond the maximum period prescribed by any law made by Parliament under sub-clause (b) of clause (7); or
such person is detained in accordance with the provisions of any law made by Parliament under sub-clauses (a) and (b) of clause (7).

Clauses.ClauseDesc: When any person is detained in pursuance of an order made under any law providing for preventive detention, the authority making the order shall, as soon as may be, communicate to such person the grounds on which the order has been made and shall afford him the earliest opportunity of making a representation against the order.

Nothing in clause (5) shall require the authority making any such order as is referred to in that clause to disclose facts which such authority considers to be against the public interest to disclose.
Parliament may by law prescribe—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the circumstances under which, and the class or classes of cases in which, a person may be detained for a period longer than three months under any law providing for preventive detention without obtaining the opinion of an Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of sub-clause (a) of clause (4);
the maximum period for which any person may in any class or classes of cases be detained under any law providing for preventive detention; and
the procedure to be followed by an Advisory Board in an inquiry under sub-clause (a) of clause (4).

Name: Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Traffic in human beings and begar and other similar forms of forced labour are prohibited and any contravention of this provision shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from imposing compulsory service for public purposes, and in imposing such service the State shall not make any discrimination on grounds only of religion, race, caste or class or any of them.

Name: Prohibition of employment of children in factories, etc.
ArtDesc: No child below the age of fourteen years shall be employed to work in any factory or mine or engaged in any other hazardous employment.

Name: Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice and propagation of religion.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Subject to public order, morality and health and to the other provisions of this Part, all persons are equally entitled to freedom of conscience and the right freely to profess, practise and propagate religion.
Nothing in this article shall affect the operation of any existing law or prevent the State from making any law—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: regulating or restricting any economic, financial, political or other secular activity which may be associated with religious practice;
providing for social welfare and reform or the throwing open of Hindu religious institutions of a public character to all classes and sections of Hindus.

Explanations.Explanation: The wearing and carrying of kirpans shall be deemed to be included in the profession of the Sikh religion.

In sub-clause (b) of clause (2), the reference to Hindus shall be construed as including a reference to persons professing the Sikh, Jaina or Buddhist religion, and the reference to Hindu religious institutions shall be construed accordingly.

Name: Freedom to manage religious affairs.
Freedom as to payment of taxes for promotion of any particular religion.
ArtDesc: No person shall be compelled to pay any taxes, the proceeds of which are specifically appropriated in payment of expenses for the promotion or maintenance of any particular religion or religious denomination.

Name: Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction or religious worship in certain educational institutions

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No religious instruction shall be provided in any educational institution wholly maintained out of State funds.

Nothing in clause (1) shall apply to an educational institution which is administered by the State but has been established under any endowment or trust which requires that religious instruction shall be imparted in such institution.

No person attending any educational institution recognised by the State or receiving aid out of State funds shall be required to take part in any religious instruction that may be imparted in such institution or to attend any religious worship that may be conducted in such institution or in any premises attached thereto unless such person or, if such person is a minor, his guardian has given his consent thereto.
Any section of the citizens residing in the territory of India or any part thereof having a distinct language, script or culture of its own shall have the right to conserve the same.
No citizen shall be denied admission into any educational institution maintained by the State or receiving aid out of State funds on grounds only of religion, race, caste, language or any of them.

Name: Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All minorities, whether based on religion or language, shall have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice.

In making any law providing for the compulsory acquisition of any property of an educational institution established and administered by a minority, referred to in clause (1), the State shall ensure that the amount fixed by or determined under such law for the acquisition of such property is such as would not restrict or abrogate the right guaranteed under that clause.

The State shall not, in granting aid to educational institutions, discriminate against any educational institution on the ground that it is under the management of a minority, whether based on religion or language.

Name: Compulsory acquisition of property.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution

Name: Saving of laws providing for acquisition of estates, etc.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Notwithstanding anything contained in article 13, no law providing for—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the acquisition by the State of any estate or of any rights therein or the extinguishment or modification of any such rights, or
the taking over of the management of any property by the State for a limited period either in the public interest or in order to secure the proper management of the property, or
the amalgamation of two or more corporations either in the public interest or in order to secure the proper management of any of the corporations, or

the extinguishment or modification of any rights of managing agents, secretaries and treasurers, managing directors, directors or managers of corporations, or of any voting rights of shareholders thereof, or

the extinguishment or modification of any rights accruing by virtue of any agreement, lease or licence for the purpose of searching for, or winning, any mineral or mineral oil, or the premature termination or cancellation of any such agreement, lease or licence,

Clauses.FollowUp:
shall be deemed to be void on the ground that it is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by article 14 or article 19:
Provided that where such law is a law made by the Legislature of a State, the provisions of this article shall not apply thereto unless such law, having been reserved for the consideration of the President, has received his assent:
Provided further that where any law makes any provision for the acquisition by the State of any estate and where any land comprised therein is held by a person under his personal cultivation, it shall not be lawful for the State to acquire any portion of such land as is within the ceiling limit applicable to him under any law for the time being in force or any building or structure standing thereon or appurtenant thereto, unless the law relating to the acquisition of such land, building or structure, provides for payment of compensation at a rate which shall not be less than the market value thereof.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: In this article,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the expression “rights”, in relation to an estate, shall include any rights vesting in a proprietor, sub-proprietor, under-proprietor, tenure-holder, raiyat, under-raiyator other intermediary and any rights or privileges in respect of land revenue.

Name: Validation of certain Acts and Regulations.
ArtDesc: Without prejudice to the generality of the provisions contained in article 31A, none of the Acts and Regulations specified in the Ninth Schedule nor any of the provisions thereof shall be deemed to be void, or ever to have become void, on the ground that such Act, Regulation or provision is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by, any provisions of this Part, and notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any court or Tribunal to the contrary, each of the said Acts and Regulations shall, subject to the power of any competent Legislature to repeal or amend it, continue in force.

Name: Saving of laws giving effect to certain directive principles.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything contained in article 13, no law giving effect to the policy of the State towards securing all or any of the principles laid down in Part IV shall be deemed to be void on the ground that it is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by article 14 or article 19; and no law containing a declaration that it is for giving effect to such policy shall be called in question in any court on the ground that it does not give effect to such policy:
Provided that where such law is made by the Legislature of a State, the provisions of this article shall not apply thereto unless such law, having been reserved for the consideration of the President, has received his assent.

Name: Saving of laws in respect of anti-national activities.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution.

Name: Remedies for enforcement of rights conferred by this Part.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: The right to move the Supreme Court by appropriate proceedings for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this Part is guaranteed.

The Supreme Court shall have power to issue directions or orders or writs, including writs in the nature of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, quo warranto and certiorari, whichever may be appropriate, for the enforcement of any of the rights conferred by this Part.

Without prejudice to the powers conferred on the Supreme Court by clauses (1) and (2), Parliament may by law empower any other court to exercise within the local limits of its jurisdiction all or any of the powers exercisable by the Supreme Court under clause (2)
The right guaranteed by this article shall not be suspended except as otherwise provided for by this Constitution.

Name: Constitutional validity of State laws not to be considered in proceedings under article 32.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution.

Name: Power of Parliament to modify the rights conferred by this Part in their application to Forces, etc.
ArtDesc:
Parliament may, by law, determine to what extent any of the rights conferred by this Part shall, in their application to,—
(a) the members of the Armed Forces; or
(b) the members of the Forces charged with the maintenance of public order; or
(c) persons employed in any bureau or other organisation established by the State for purposes of intelligence or counter intelligence; or
(d) person employed in, or in connection with, the telecommunication systems set up for the purposes of any Force, bureau or organisation referred to in clauses (a) to (c), be restricted or abrogated so as to ensure the proper discharge of their duties and the maintenance of discipline among them.

Name: Restriction on rights conferred by this Part while martial law is in force in any area.
ArtDesc: Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing provisions of this Part, Parliament may by law indemnify any person in the service of the Union or of a State or any other person in respect of any act done by him in connection with the maintenance or restoration of order in any area within the territory of India where martial law was in force or validate any sentence passed, punishment inflicted, forfeiture ordered or other act done under martial law in such area.

Name: Legislation to give effect to the provisions of this Part.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in this Constitution,—
(a) Parliament shall have, and the Legislature of a State shall not have, power to make laws—
(i) with respect to any of the matters which under clause (3) of article 16, clause (3) of article 32, article 33 and article 34 may be provided for by law made by Parliament; and
(ii) for prescribing punishment for those acts which are declared to be offences under this Part,
and Parliament shall, as soon as may be after the commencement of this Constitution, make laws for prescribing punishment for the acts referred to in sub-clause (ii);
(b) any law in force immediately before the commencement of this Constitution in the territory of India with respect to any of the matters referred to in sub-clause (i) of clause (a) or providing for punishment for any act referred to in sub-clause (ii) of that clause shall, subject to the terms thereof and to any adaptations and modifications that may be made therein under article 372, continue in force until altered or repealed or amended by Parliament.

Explanations.Explanation: In this article, the expression “law in force” has the same meaning as in article 372.

Name: Definition of 'State'
ArtDesc: Defines 'State' to include the Government and Parliament of India, State governments, and local authorities.

Name: Application of Directive Principles
ArtDesc: States that the Directive Principles of State Policy are fundamental in governance but are not enforceable by courts.

Name: Social Justice
ArtDesc: Mandates the State to promote welfare by securing a just social order, ensuring justice—social, economic, and political.

Name: Economic and Social Rights
ArtDesc: Lists principles for the State, including the right to adequate means of livelihood and equal pay for equal work.

Name: Local Self-Government
ArtDesc: Directs the State to organize village panchayats as units of self-government.

Name: Rights to Work and Education
ArtDesc: Recognizes the right to work, education, and public assistance as responsibilities of the State.

Name: Labor Rights
ArtDesc: Requires the State to ensure just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief.

Name: Workers' Welfare
ArtDesc: Aims to secure a living wage and decent working conditions for workers.

Name: Uniform Civil Code
ArtDesc: Calls for a uniform civil code for all citizens to ensure equality and justice in personal laws.

Name: Early Childhood Education
ArtDesc: Directs the State to provide early childhood care and education for children until they are six years old.

Name: Promotion of Weaker Sections
ArtDesc: Mandates the State to promote the educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and other weaker sections.

Name: Health and Nutrition
ArtDesc: Obligates the State to raise the level of nutrition and standard of living and improve public health.

Name: Agriculture and Animal Husbandry
ArtDesc: Directs the State to organize agriculture and animal husbandry on modern and scientific lines.

Name: Cultural Heritage
ArtDesc: Requires the State to protect monuments and places of national importance and promote cultural heritage.

Name: Separation of Judiciary from Executive
ArtDesc: Directs the State to separate the judiciary from the executive in public services to ensure judicial independence.

Name: Promotion of International Peace and Security
ArtDesc: Mandates the State to promote international peace and security and maintain just relations between nations.

Name: Establishment of the President of India
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of the office of the President of India as the constitutional head of the state.

Name: Executive Power of the President
ArtDesc: States that the executive power of the Union shall be vested in the President and exercised by him/her.

Name: Election of the President
ArtDesc: Details the procedure for the election of the President of India by an electoral college.

Name: Manner of Election of the President
ArtDesc: Specifies the manner of election to ensure proportional representation in the election of the President.

Name: Term of Office of President
ArtDesc: States that the President shall hold office for a term of five years but is eligible for reelection.

Name: Eligibility for Reelection
ArtDesc: Clarifies that a President who has completed a term is eligible for reelection.

Name: Qualifications for Election as President
ArtDesc: Lays down the qualifications necessary for a person to be elected as President.

Name: Conditions of President’s Office
ArtDesc: Outlines the conditions under which a person can hold the office of the President, including the need to take an oath of office.

Name: Oath or Affirmation by the President
ArtDesc: Requires the President to take an oath or affirmation before assuming the role.

Name: Procedure for Impeachment of the President
ArtDesc: Details the procedure for the impeachment of the President for violation of the Constitution.

Name: Time of Holding Election to the Office of President
ArtDesc: Specifies the time frame for holding elections for the office of the President.

Name: Provision for Vice-President
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of the office of the Vice-President of India.

Name: Vice-President to be Ex-Officio Chairman of the Council of States
ArtDesc: States that the Vice-President shall be the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.

Name: Powers of Vice-President
ArtDesc: Outlines the powers of the Vice-President when acting as President.

Name: Election of Vice-President
ArtDesc: Details the procedure for the election of the Vice-President.

Name: Term of Office of Vice-President
ArtDesc: States that the Vice-President shall hold office for a term of five years but is eligible for reelection.

Name: Time of Holding Election to the Office of Vice-President
ArtDesc: Specifies the time frame for holding elections for the office of the Vice-President.

Name: Oath or Affirmation by the Vice-President
ArtDesc: Requires the Vice-President to take an oath or affirmation before assuming office.

Name: Discharge of President’s Functions in Certain Cases
ArtDesc: Provides for the discharge of the President’s functions during a vacancy or inability to perform duties.

Name: Disputes Regarding Election of President and Vice-President
ArtDesc: States that any dispute concerning the election of the President or Vice-President shall be settled by the Supreme Court.

Name: Power of President to Grant Pardons
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to grant pardons, reprieves, respites, or remissions of punishment.

Name: Extent of Executive Power of the Union
ArtDesc: Specifies the extent of the executive power of the Union, extending to matters in the Concurrent List.

Name: Council of Ministers to Aid and Advise President
ArtDesc: States that the President shall act according to the advice of the Council of Ministers.

Name: Appointment of Prime Minister
ArtDesc: Provides for the appointment of the Prime Minister by the President.

Name: Attorney General for India
ArtDesc: Establishes the office of the Attorney General of India as the chief legal advisor to the Government of India.

Name: Conduct of Business of the Government of India
ArtDesc: Outlines how the business of the Government of India shall be conducted.

Name: Duties of Prime Minister Regarding the Council of Ministers
ArtDesc: Specifies the duties of the Prime Minister in relation to the Council of Ministers.

Name: Establishment of Parliament
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a Parliament for the Union.

Name: Composition of the Rajya Sabha
ArtDesc: Outlines the composition of the Rajya Sabha (Council of States).

Name: Composition of the Lok Sabha
ArtDesc: Defines the composition of the Lok Sabha (House of the People).

Name: Readjustment After Each Census
ArtDesc: Requires the readjustment of constituencies after each census.

Name: Duration of Houses of Parliament
ArtDesc: States that the Lok Sabha shall have a term of five years, while the Rajya Sabha is a permanent body.

Name: Qualification for Membership of Parliament
ArtDesc: Lays down the qualifications necessary for membership in Parliament.

Name: Sessions of Parliament
ArtDesc: Specifies the summoning and proroguing of Parliament sessions.

Name: Right of President to Address and Send Messages
ArtDesc: Gives the President the right to address Parliament and send messages.

Name: Special Address by the President
ArtDesc: Mandates the President to address both Houses of Parliament at the commencement of the first session after each general election.

Name: Rights of Ministers to Attend and Speak in Parliament
ArtDesc: Provides that ministers have the right to attend and speak in both Houses of Parliament.

Name: The Vice-President's Role in Rajya Sabha
ArtDesc: Outlines the Vice-President's role as the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.

Name: Provisions for the Rajya Sabha
ArtDesc: Specifies rules for the Rajya Sabha regarding quorum and business.

Name: Provisions for the Lok Sabha
ArtDesc: Specifies rules for the Lok Sabha regarding quorum and business.

Name: Power of Parliament to Make Laws
ArtDesc: Grants Parliament the power to make laws for the whole or any part of India.

Name: Speaker and Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha
ArtDesc: Provides for the election of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.

Name: Vacation of Seats
ArtDesc: Outlines the conditions under which a member's seat in Parliament may become vacant.

Name: Powers of Speaker
ArtDesc: Specifies the powers of the Speaker of the Lok Sabha, including the conduct of proceedings.

Name: Powers of Deputy Speaker
ArtDesc: Outlines the powers and functions of the Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.

Name: Speaker's Casting Vote
ArtDesc: States that the Speaker shall have a casting vote in case of a tie.

Name: Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha
ArtDesc: Provides for the conduct of business in the Lok Sabha.

Name: Voting in Parliament
ArtDesc: Specifies how voting shall take place in Parliament.

Name: Quorum for Meetings of Parliament
ArtDesc: Defines the quorum necessary for the meetings of both Houses of Parliament.

Name: Disqualification for Membership
ArtDesc: Outlines the grounds for disqualification of a member of Parliament.

Name: Disqualifications on the Grounds of Defection
ArtDesc: Specifies disqualifications for members on the grounds of defection.

Name: Decision on Disqualifications
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to decide on disqualifications of members under certain circumstances.

Name: Disqualification on Certain Grounds
ArtDesc: Further clarifies grounds for disqualification of members of Parliament.

Name: Powers, Privileges, and Immunities of Parliament
ArtDesc: Defines the powers, privileges, and immunities enjoyed by Parliament.

Name: Salaries and Allowances of Members
ArtDesc: Provides for the salaries and allowances of members of Parliament.

Name: Provisions for the Introduction of Bills
ArtDesc: Specifies how bills may be introduced in Parliament.

Name: Joint Sitting of Parliament
ArtDesc: Provides for the procedure of a joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament.

Name: Special Procedure in Case of Money Bills
ArtDesc: Outlines the procedure for handling Money Bills in Parliament.

Name: Definition of Money Bills
ArtDesc: Defines what constitutes a Money Bill.

Name: Assent to Bills
ArtDesc: States that the President shall, after the bill is passed by Parliament, declare either that he/she assents to the bill or withholds assent.

Name: Annual Financial Statement
ArtDesc: Mandates the President to lay before Parliament the Annual Financial Statement of the revenue and expenditure of the Union.

Name: Procedure in Parliament with respect to Estimates
ArtDesc: Outlines the procedure for the presentation and discussion of the estimates of expenditure in Parliament.

Name: Appropriation Bills
ArtDesc: States that no money shall be withdrawn from the Consolidated Fund of India except under appropriation made by law.

Name: Supplementary, Additional or Excess Grants
ArtDesc: Allows for the presentation of supplementary grants for expenditure not provided for in the annual financial statement.

Name: Vote on Account
ArtDesc: Permits the Parliament to make grants in advance for the expenditure of the government for a part of the financial year.

Name: Procedure for Money Bills
ArtDesc: Details the procedure to be followed for the introduction of Money Bills in Parliament.

Name: Procedure in Parliament
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make rules for its procedure and the conduct of business.

Name: Disqualifications of Members
ArtDesc: Outlines the disqualifications that may apply to members of Parliament.

Name: Language to be used in the Parliament
ArtDesc: Specifies the languages that can be used in Parliament proceedings.

Name: Restrictions on discussion in Parliament
ArtDesc: Limits discussions in Parliament on matters pending before the courts.

Name: Prohibition of Courts from interfering in parliamentary proceedings
ArtDesc: Prevents courts from questioning the validity of proceedings in Parliament.

Name: Ordinance Making Power of the President
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to promulgate ordinances when Parliament is not in session.

Name: Establishment and Constitution of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment and constitution of the Supreme Court of India.

Name: Appointment of Acting Chief Justice
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to appoint an acting Chief Justice when the office is vacant.

Name: Power of President to appoint Judges of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Details the powers of the President to appoint judges of the Supreme Court.

Name: Appointment of ad hoc judges
ArtDesc: Allows for the appointment of ad hoc judges in the Supreme Court.

Name: Attendance of retired Judges at sittings of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Permits retired judges to sit and act as judges of the Supreme Court in certain cases.

Name: Supreme Court to be a court of record
ArtDesc: Declares the Supreme Court to be a court of record, with the power to punish for contempt.

Name: Seat of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Specifies the seat of the Supreme Court to be in Delhi.

Name: Original jurisdiction of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Defines the original jurisdiction of the Supreme Court in disputes between states or between the Union and states.

Name: Appellate jurisdiction of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Outlines the appellate jurisdiction of the Supreme Court in cases involving substantial questions of law.

Name: Appellate jurisdiction in regard to criminal matters
ArtDesc: Specifies the Supreme Court's appellate jurisdiction in criminal matters.

Name: Certification for appeal to Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Details the procedure for certification of appeals to the Supreme Court.

Name: Power of Supreme Court to review its own judgments
ArtDesc: Gives the Supreme Court the power to review its own judgments and orders.

Name: Special leave to appeal
ArtDesc: Allows the Supreme Court to grant special leave to appeal against any judgment, decree, or order.

Name: Power of Supreme Court to make rules
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to make rules for regulating its own procedure.

Name: Transfer of cases
ArtDesc: Allows for the transfer of cases from one High Court to another by the Supreme Court.

Name: Conferment on Supreme Court of powers of High Court
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to confer powers of a High Court for certain purposes.

Name: Rules for practice and procedure
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to make rules regarding its practice and procedure.

Name: Law declared by Supreme Court to be binding on all courts
ArtDesc: States that the law declared by the Supreme Court shall be binding on all courts in India.

Name: Enforcement of decrees and orders of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to enforce its decrees and orders throughout India.

Name: Advisory jurisdiction of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to give advice to the President on legal matters.

Name: Civil and judicial authorities to act in aid of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Mandates civil and judicial authorities to act in aid of the Supreme Court.

Name: Rules of procedure
ArtDesc: Empowers the Supreme Court to make rules regarding its own procedures.

Name: Officers and servants of Supreme Court
ArtDesc: Provides for the appointment of officers and servants of the Supreme Court.

Name: Interpretation
ArtDesc: Allows for the interpretation of the Constitution by the Supreme Court.

Name: Comptroller and Auditor-General of India
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of the office of the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India.

Name: Duties and powers of the Comptroller and Auditor-General
ArtDesc: Details the duties and powers of the Comptroller and Auditor-General.

Name: Accounts of the Union and States
ArtDesc: Mandates the submission of accounts of the Union and States to the Comptroller and Auditor-General.

Name: Audit Reports
ArtDesc: Requires the Comptroller and Auditor-General to present audit reports to Parliament.

Name: Definition of State
ArtDesc: Defines 'State' to include the Government and Parliament of India, State governments, and local authorities.

Name: Governor of States
ArtDesc: Provides for the appointment of a Governor for each State.

Name: Executive Power of the State
ArtDesc: States that the executive power of the State is vested in the Governor.

Name: Appointment of Governor
ArtDesc: Details the procedure for the appointment of the Governor.

Name: Term of Office of Governor
ArtDesc: Specifies the term of office for the Governor and the conditions for removal.

Name: Qualifications for Appointment as Governor
ArtDesc: Lays down the qualifications necessary for appointment as Governor.

Name: Conditions of Governor’s Office
ArtDesc: Outlines the conditions under which a person may hold the office of Governor.

Name: Oath or Affirmation by Governor
ArtDesc: Requires the Governor to take an oath or affirmation before assuming office.

Name: Discretionary Power of Governor
ArtDesc: Details the discretionary powers of the Governor.

Name: Power of Governor to grant pardons
ArtDesc: Empowers the Governor to grant pardons, reprieves, respites, or remissions of punishment.

Name: Extent of Executive Power of State
ArtDesc: Specifies the extent of the executive power of the State.

Name: Council of Ministers to aid Governor
ArtDesc: Mandates the Governor to act on the advice of the Council of Ministers.

Name: Council of Ministers
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a Council of Ministers to aid and advise the Governor.

Name: Governor to act as agent of the President
ArtDesc: States that the Governor acts as an agent of the President in certain situations.

Name: Conduct of business of the Government of a State
ArtDesc: Outlines how the business of the government of a state shall be conducted.

Name: Duties of Chief Minister regarding the Council of Ministers
ArtDesc: Specifies the duties of the Chief Minister in relation to the Council of Ministers.

Name: Establishment of Legislatures in States
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a legislature in each State.

Name: Abolition of Legislative Councils
ArtDesc: Allows for the abolition of the Legislative Council in a State.

Name: Composition of Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Outlines the composition of the Legislative Assemblies in States.

Name: Composition of Legislative Councils
ArtDesc: Specifies the composition of Legislative Councils where they exist.

Name: Duration of State Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: States that the Legislative Assembly shall have a term of five years.

Name: Qualifications for Membership of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Lays down qualifications necessary for membership in State Legislatures.

Name: Sessions of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Specifies the summoning and proroguing of sessions of State Legislatures.

Name: Address by the Governor
ArtDesc: Mandates the Governor to address the State Legislature at the commencement of the session.

Name: Special Address by the Governor
ArtDesc: Requires the Governor to address the State Legislature at the commencement of the first session after each general election.

Name: Rights of Ministers to Attend and Speak in State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Provides that ministers have the right to attend and speak in the State Legislature.

Name: The Speaker and Deputy Speaker of State Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Details the provisions for the election of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of State Legislative Assemblies.

Name: Vacation of Seats
ArtDesc: Outlines the conditions under which a member's seat in the State Legislature may become vacant.

Name: Powers of Speaker
ArtDesc: Specifies the powers of the Speaker of the State Legislative Assembly.

Name: Powers of Deputy Speaker
ArtDesc: Outlines the powers and functions of the Deputy Speaker of the State Legislative Assembly.

Name: Speaker's Casting Vote
ArtDesc: States that the Speaker shall have a casting vote in case of a tie.

Name: Conduct of Business in State Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Provides for the conduct of business in State Legislative Assemblies.

Name: Voting in State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Specifies how voting shall take place in State Legislatures.

Name: Quorum for Meetings of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Defines the quorum necessary for meetings of State Legislatures.

Name: Disqualification for Membership
ArtDesc: Outlines the grounds for disqualification of a member of a State Legislature.

Name: Disqualifications on the Grounds of Defection
ArtDesc: Specifies disqualifications for members of State Legislatures on the grounds of defection.

Name: Decision on Disqualifications
ArtDesc: Empowers the Governor to decide on disqualifications of members under certain circumstances.

Name: Powers, Privileges, and Immunities of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Defines the powers, privileges, and immunities enjoyed by State Legislatures.

Name: Salaries and Allowances of Members
ArtDesc: Provides for the salaries and allowances of members of State Legislatures.

Name: Provisions for the Introduction of Bills
ArtDesc: Specifies how bills may be introduced in State Legislatures.

Name: Joint Sitting of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Provides for the procedure of a joint sitting of both Houses of State Legislatures.

Name: Special Procedure in Case of Money Bills
ArtDesc: Outlines the procedure for handling Money Bills in State Legislatures.

Name: Definition of Money Bills
ArtDesc: Defines what constitutes a Money Bill in State Legislatures.

Name: Powers of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Specifies the powers of State Legislatures to make laws.

Name: Application of Certain Provisions to the State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Applies certain provisions of the Constitution to the State Legislatures.

Name: Application of provisions of Article 194
ArtDesc: Specifies the application of provisions related to the powers of State Legislatures.

Name: Re-enactment of laws
ArtDesc: Allows for the re-enactment of laws by State Legislatures.

Name: Right to speak and to be heard
ArtDesc: Ensures the right to speak and be heard in State Legislatures.

Name: Assent to Bills by the Governor
ArtDesc: States that the Governor may assent to a bill, withhold assent, or return it for reconsideration.

Name: Power of Governor to Disallow Bills
ArtDesc: Empowers the Governor to disallow certain bills passed by the State Legislature.

Name: Annual Financial Statement
ArtDesc: Requires the Governor to lay before the State Legislature an annual financial statement.

Name: Expenditure from Consolidated Fund
ArtDesc: States that no money shall be withdrawn from the Consolidated Fund of the State without the authority of law.

Name: Appropriation Bills
ArtDesc: Specifies that an appropriation bill is required for the withdrawal of funds from the Consolidated Fund.

Name: Supplementary Grants
ArtDesc: Provides for supplementary grants in case of unforeseen expenditures.

Name: Excess Grants
ArtDesc: States the procedure for excess grants that exceed the authorized expenditure.

Name: Money Bills
ArtDesc: Defines the criteria for a bill to be classified as a Money Bill.

Name: Rules of Procedure
ArtDesc: Empowers each House of the State Legislature to make rules for its procedure.

Name: Disqualification for Membership
ArtDesc: Specifies grounds for disqualification of members of the State Legislature.

Name: Powers of State Legislatures
ArtDesc: States the legislative powers of State Legislatures in relation to various subjects.

Name: Prohibition of Discrimination
ArtDesc: Prohibits discrimination in legislative matters.

Name: Immunities of Legislatures
ArtDesc: Grants certain immunities to the State Legislature.

Name: Power of Governor to Promulgate Ordinances
ArtDesc: Empowers the Governor to promulgate ordinances during the recess of the State Legislature.

Name: High Courts for States
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of High Courts for states.

Name: High Courts to be Courts of Record
ArtDesc: Declares that High Courts shall be courts of record.

Name: Composition of High Courts
ArtDesc: Details the composition and appointment of judges in High Courts.

Name: Appointment and Conditions of Service of High Court Judges
ArtDesc: Specifies the appointment process and service conditions for High Court judges.

Name: Constitution of High Courts
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to determine the constitution of High Courts.

Name: Oath or Affirmation by Judges
ArtDesc: Requires judges of the High Court to take an oath or affirmation before assuming office.

Name: Powers of High Court to Transfer Cases
ArtDesc: Gives High Courts the power to transfer cases from one court to another.

Name: Salaries, Allowances, and Pensions of High Court Judges
ArtDesc: Provides for the salaries, allowances, and pensions of High Court judges.

Name: Transfer of High Court Judges
ArtDesc: Allows for the transfer of judges from one High Court to another.

Name: Appointment of Additional Judges
ArtDesc: Provides for the appointment of additional judges in High Courts.

Name: Appointment of Acting Judges
ArtDesc: Allows for the appointment of acting judges in High Courts.

Name: Applicability of Existing Laws
ArtDesc: States that existing laws will continue to apply to High Courts.

Name: Power of High Court to Issue Writs
ArtDesc: Empowers High Courts to issue writs for the enforcement of fundamental rights.

Name: Supervisory Jurisdiction of High Courts
ArtDesc: Grants High Courts supervisory jurisdiction over all courts and tribunals within their jurisdiction.

Name: Power of High Court to Withdraw Cases
ArtDesc: Allows High Courts to withdraw cases from lower courts.

Name: Annual Reports of High Courts
ArtDesc: Requires High Courts to prepare and submit annual reports.

Name: Extension of Jurisdiction of High Courts
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to extend the jurisdiction of High Courts.

Name: Establishment of a National Judicial Appointments Commission
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a commission for the appointment of judges.

Name: Judicial Leadership
ArtDesc: Outlines the leadership structure in the judiciary.

Name: Appointment of District Judges
ArtDesc: Specifies the appointment process for district judges.

Name: Conditions of Service of District Judges
ArtDesc: Details the conditions of service for district judges.

Name: Control of High Courts over Subordinate Courts
ArtDesc: Grants High Courts control over subordinate courts.

Name: Establishment of Tribunals
ArtDesc: Empowers the government to establish tribunals for various matters.

Name: Power of Tribunals to Determine their Procedure
ArtDesc: Allows tribunals to determine their own procedure.

Name: Special Provisions for Certain Areas
ArtDesc: Provides special provisions for certain areas in the country.

Name: Administration of Union Territories
ArtDesc: Details the administration of Union Territories.

Name: Legislative Powers of Union Territories
ArtDesc: Specifies the legislative powers of Union Territories.

Name: High Courts for Union Territories
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of High Courts for Union Territories.

Name: Provisions for certain Scheduled Areas
ArtDesc: Details provisions applicable to Scheduled Areas.

Name: Panchayats
ArtDesc: Empowers the State Legislature to establish Panchayats.

Name: Administration of Scheduled Areas
ArtDesc: Specifies the administration of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes.

Name: Legislative Power of the Union and States
ArtDesc: Outlines the legislative power of the Union and States.

Name: Distribution of Legislative Powers
ArtDesc: Details the distribution of legislative powers between the Union and States.

Name: Power of Parliament to Make Laws for Certain Matters
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to legislate on certain matters.

Name: Residual Powers
ArtDesc: Specifies that residual powers lie with the Union.

Name: Power of Parliament to Legislate in National Interest
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to legislate in the national interest.

Name: Power of Parliament to Legislate for States in Certain Cases
ArtDesc: Allows Parliament to legislate for States under certain circumstances.

Name: Power of Parliament to Legislate in Certain Matters
ArtDesc: Provides for legislative powers in certain specified matters.

Name: Power of Parliament to Legislate for Two or More States
ArtDesc: Allows Parliament to legislate for two or more States.

Name: Power of Parliament to Legislate for Implementation of International Treaties
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to legislate for implementing international treaties.

Name: Inconsistency between Laws Made by Parliament and Laws Made by State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Addresses inconsistencies between Union and State laws.

Name: Laws Made by Parliament to Prevail in Certain Cases
ArtDesc: Specifies that laws made by Parliament prevail in certain cases.

Name: Obligation of States to Implement Laws Made by Parliament
ArtDesc: Requires States to implement laws made by Parliament.

Name: Control of the Union over States
ArtDesc: Outlines the control of the Union over States.

Name: Power of the Union to Direct the States
ArtDesc: Empowers the Union to direct States in certain matters.

Name: Power of the Union to Make Laws for States
ArtDesc: Allows the Union to make laws for States in certain circumstances.

Name: Power of the Union to Make Laws for Union Territories
ArtDesc: Empowers the Union to legislate for Union Territories.

Name: Public Records and Judicial Proceedings
ArtDesc: Requires States to recognize public records and judicial proceedings of other States.

Name: Disputes Relating to Waters
ArtDesc: Addresses disputes relating to inter-State waters.

Name: Provisions for the Administration of Scheduled Areas
ArtDesc: Specifies provisions for the administration of Scheduled Areas.

Name: Cooperative Societies
ArtDesc: Empowers the State to promote cooperative societies.

Name: Taxation
ArtDesc: States that no tax shall be levied without the authority of law.

Name: Consolidated Funds
ArtDesc: Describes the management of the Consolidated Fund of the State.

Name: Contingency Funds
ArtDesc: Outlines provisions for the establishment of Contingency Funds.

Name: Taxes Levied by Union but Collected by States
ArtDesc: Specifies taxes levied by the Union but collected by States.

Name: Taxes Levied and Collected by the Union and Distributed Between the Union and States
ArtDesc: Details taxes levied and collected by the Union and shared with States.

Name: Taxes Levied by States but Collected by Union
ArtDesc: Describes taxes levied by States but collected by the Union.

Name: Surcharge on Certain Taxes
ArtDesc: Allows for surcharges on certain taxes.

Name: Revenue from Property
ArtDesc: Specifies the revenue collected from properties owned by the Union.

Name: Grants-in-Aid
ArtDesc: Provides for grants-in-aid from the Union to States.

Name: Parliament's Power to Make Laws for Certain Taxes
ArtDesc: Allows Parliament to make laws for certain taxes.

Name: Grants-in-Aid to Certain States
ArtDesc: Specifies grants-in-aid to certain States.

Name: Taxes on Professions, Trades, Callings, and Employments
ArtDesc: Details taxes imposed on professions, trades, and employments.

Name: Power of States to Tax
ArtDesc: Allows States to levy taxes in certain areas.

Name: State Finance Commissions
ArtDesc: Empowers the establishment of State Finance Commissions.

Name: State Finance Commissions
ArtDesc: Outlines the functions and powers of State Finance Commissions.

Name: Finance Commission
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a Finance Commission to recommend financial distribution.

Name: Recommendations of Finance Commission
ArtDesc: Specifies the nature of recommendations made by the Finance Commission.

Name: Grants for the purpose of the Union and States
ArtDesc: Allows for grants for the purpose of both the Union and States.

Name: Administration of Union Territory Finances
ArtDesc: Specifies the administration of finances for Union Territories.

Name: Audit of Accounts
ArtDesc: Requires the audit of accounts of the Union and States.

Name: Sovereign Immunity
ArtDesc: Grants immunity to the Union against suits for recovery of property.

Name: Restrictions on Trade, Commerce, and Intercourse
ArtDesc: Imposes restrictions on trade and commerce between States.

Name: Restrictions on Trade and Commerce
ArtDesc: Outlines further restrictions on trade and commerce.

Name: Taxes on Sale or Purchase of Goods
ArtDesc: States provisions regarding taxation on goods and services.

Name: Taxation by States
ArtDesc: Details taxation powers of States.

Name: Grants for the purpose of Union and States
ArtDesc: Allows for grants to States from the Union.

Name: Payments to States
ArtDesc: Specifies payments made to States.

Name: Contingency Funds
ArtDesc: Outlines provisions for the establishment of Contingency Funds.

Name: Loans by the Union to States
ArtDesc: Details provisions regarding loans from the Union to States.

Name: Property of the Union
ArtDesc: Specifies the properties owned by the Union.

Name: Property of the States
ArtDesc: Specifies the properties owned by States.

Name: Properties and Liabilities of States
ArtDesc: Details the liabilities and properties of States.

Name: Properties of the Union
ArtDesc: Specifies properties belonging to the Union.

Name: Power to Acquire Property
ArtDesc: Empowers the government to acquire property.

Name: Contracts
ArtDesc: States provisions regarding contracts made by the government.

Name: Suits by and Against the Government
ArtDesc: Details the provisions for suits by and against the government.

Name: Freedom of Trade, Commerce, and Intercourse
ArtDesc: Guarantees freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse throughout the territory of India.

Name: Power of Parliament to Regulate Trade and Commerce
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make laws for regulating trade and commerce in the public interest.

Name: Restrictions on Trade, Commerce, and Intercourse
ArtDesc: Imposes restrictions on trade, commerce, and intercourse for certain States or persons.

Name: Restrictions on Trade and Commerce
ArtDesc: Allows for laws to be made by the State regarding trade and commerce with certain restrictions.

Name: Saving of Existing Laws
ArtDesc: Provides that existing laws regulating trade and commerce are saved.

Name: Power of the Union to Make Laws for Certain States
ArtDesc: Empowers the Union to legislate for certain States in regard to trade and commerce.

Name: Appointment of Authority for Carrying Out the Provisions of Article 304
ArtDesc: Provides for the appointment of an authority to enforce the provisions of Article 304.

Name: State Legislatures' Power to Make Laws
ArtDesc: States that State Legislatures can make laws for matters related to trade and commerce.

Name: Recruitment and Conditions of Service
ArtDesc: Deals with the recruitment and conditions of service of persons serving in the Union or State.

Name: Tenure of Office of Members of Services
ArtDesc: States that members of services shall hold office during the pleasure of the President or Governor.

Name: Dismissal, Removal or Reduction in Rank of Persons
ArtDesc: Lays down the procedure for the dismissal or removal of public servants.

Name: All-India Services
ArtDesc: Provides for the creation of All-India Services by the Parliament.

Name: Provisions for the Service of the Union
ArtDesc: Specifies the service conditions for officers of the Union.

Name: Power to Alter the Conditions of Service
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to alter the conditions of service of officers.

Name: Public Service Commissions
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of Public Service Commissions for the Union and States.

Name: Composition of the Public Service Commissions
ArtDesc: States the composition of the Public Service Commission.

Name: Appointment of Members of the Commission
ArtDesc: Deals with the appointment and removal of members of the Public Service Commission.

Name: Power to Make Regulations
ArtDesc: Empowers the President and Governors to make regulations for the Public Service Commission.

Name: Conditions of Service of Members
ArtDesc: Lays down the conditions of service for members of the Public Service Commission.

Name: Functions of Public Service Commissions
ArtDesc: Specifies the functions of the Public Service Commissions.

Name: Power of the President to Make Appointments
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to appoint individuals to certain services.

Name: Expenditure for the Services
ArtDesc: Provides for the expenditure incurred by the Public Service Commission.

Name: Reports of Public Service Commissions
ArtDesc: Mandates the Public Service Commission to report on its work.

Name: Elections to the Parliament and to the Legislatures of States
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of the Election Commission for conducting elections.

Name: Elections to the House of the People
ArtDesc: States that all citizens of India shall be eligible to vote in elections to the House of the People.

Name: Elections to the Legislative Assembly
ArtDesc: Provides for free and fair elections to the Legislative Assembly.

Name: Power of Parliament to Make Provisions for Elections
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make provisions for the conduct of elections.

Name: Power of the Legislature of a State
ArtDesc: Empowers State Legislatures to make provisions for the conduct of elections.

Name: Elections to the Parliament and State Legislatures
ArtDesc: Details provisions for the conduct of elections to Parliament and State Legislatures.

Name: Reservation of Seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
ArtDesc: Reserves seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the Lok Sabha and State Assemblies.

Name: Representation of Anglo-Indian Community
ArtDesc: Provides for the representation of the Anglo-Indian community in the Lok Sabha.

Name: Reservation of Seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Reserves seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in State Legislative Assemblies.

Name: Representation of Anglo-Indians in Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Provides for representation of Anglo-Indians in State Legislative Assemblies.

Name: Duration of Provisions for the Reservation of Seats
ArtDesc: Specifies the duration of reservations for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.

Name: Claims of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes to Services and Posts
ArtDesc: States that the claims of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes for services shall be taken into account.

Name: Special Provisions for Certain Services
ArtDesc: Provides special provisions for the services of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.

Name: Special Provisions for the Anglo-Indian Community
ArtDesc: Provides special provisions for the Anglo-Indian community.

Name: National Commission for Scheduled Castes
ArtDesc: Establishes a National Commission for Scheduled Castes.

Name: National Commission for Scheduled Tribes
ArtDesc: Establishes a National Commission for Scheduled Tribes.

Name: Commission for the Linguistic Minorities
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a Commission for the Linguistic Minorities.

Name: Scheduled Castes
ArtDesc: States the provisions for the recognition of Scheduled Castes.

Name: Scheduled Tribes
ArtDesc: States the provisions for the recognition of Scheduled Tribes.

Name: Official Language of the Union
ArtDesc: Declares Hindi as the official language of the Union.

Name: Commission for the Official Languages
ArtDesc: Establishes a Commission for the Official Languages.

Name: Official Languages of the States
ArtDesc: Allows States to adopt their own official languages.

Name: Special Provision for Certain Languages
ArtDesc: Provides for special provisions for certain languages.

Name: Special Provision Relating to Certain Languages
ArtDesc: Allows for the recognition of certain languages spoken by a section of the population.

Name: Language to be Used in the Supreme Court and High Courts
ArtDesc: Specifies the language to be used in the Supreme Court and High Courts.

Name: Special Procedure for Enacting Certain Laws
ArtDesc: Outlines special procedures for enacting certain laws related to languages.

Name: Right to Represent and Complaints Regarding the Language
ArtDesc: Grants the right to represent grievances related to language issues.

Name: Directive for Development of the Hindi Language
ArtDesc: Mandates the promotion of the Hindi language.

Name: Proclamation of Emergency
ArtDesc: Provides for the proclamation of emergency in case of war or external aggression.

Name: Effects of Proclamation of Emergency
ArtDesc: Specifies the effects of the proclamation of emergency on the Constitution.

Name: Application of Provisions Relating to Emergency
ArtDesc: States the provisions that apply during a proclamation of emergency.

Name: Duty of the Union to Protect States
ArtDesc: Mandates the Union to protect States against external aggression and internal disturbances.

Name: Proclamation of President's Rule
ArtDesc: Allows for the proclamation of President's Rule in a State under certain conditions.

Name: Powers of the President During President's Rule
ArtDesc: Specifies the powers of the President during the imposition of President's Rule.

Name: Suspension of Fundamental Rights During Emergency
ArtDesc: States that the enforcement of certain Fundamental Rights can be suspended during emergency.

Name: Power to Suspend the Enforcement of Rights
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to suspend the enforcement of rights during emergency.

Name: Proclamation of Financial Emergency
ArtDesc: Provides for the proclamation of financial emergency under specific circumstances.

Name: Protection of President and Governors
ArtDesc: Grants immunity to the President and Governors against legal proceedings.

Name: Regulations by the President
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to make regulations for certain areas.

Name: Disputes Relating to the Water
ArtDesc: Provides for the resolution of disputes regarding the water between States.

Name: Power to Make Laws for Certain Matters
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make laws for matters related to the Constitution.

Name: Failure of Constitutional Machinery
ArtDesc: States the provisions for failure of constitutional machinery in a State.

Name: Definitions
ArtDesc: Provides definitions for terms used in the Constitution.

Name: Interpretation
ArtDesc: Lays down rules for the interpretation of the Constitution.

Name: Power of Parliament to Amend the Constitution
ArtDesc: Grants Parliament the power to amend the Constitution.

Name: Temporary Provisions
ArtDesc: Provides for temporary provisions related to certain States.

Name: Temporary Provisions with Respect to Jammu and Kashmir
ArtDesc: Provides special provisions for the State of Jammu and Kashmir.

Name: Special Provisions for North-Eastern States
ArtDesc: Makes special provisions for the North-Eastern States.

Name: Continuance in Force of Existing Laws
ArtDesc: States that existing laws shall continue to be in force.

Name: Power of the President to Make Regulations
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to make regulations for the Union Territory.

Name: Transitional Provisions
ArtDesc: Deals with transitional provisions during the transition of power.

Name: Continuation of Certain Laws
ArtDesc: States that certain laws shall continue in force until repealed.

Name: Power of President to make appointments
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to make appointments during transitional periods.

Name: Reappointment of Officers
ArtDesc: Provides for the reappointment of certain officers.

Name: Composition of the Commission
ArtDesc: Specifies the composition of the Commission for certain areas.

Name: Power to Extend Provisions
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to extend provisions to certain areas.

Name: Power of the President to Appoint a Commission
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to appoint a Commission for certain purposes.

Name: Power of President to make regulations for the Union Territory
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to make regulations for the Union Territory.

Name: Transitional Provisions for Union Territories
ArtDesc: Specifies transitional provisions for Union Territories.

Name: Power to make laws for Union Territories
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make laws for Union Territories.

Name: Commission for the Union Territories
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of a Commission for Union Territories.

Name: Power to Appoint Officers
ArtDesc: Empowers the President to appoint officers for Union Territories.

Name: Rights of the President in Relation to Union Territories
ArtDesc: Specifies the rights of the President concerning Union Territories.

Name: Provisions for Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Provides for the establishment of Legislative Assemblies in Union Territories.

Name: Elections to the Legislative Assemblies
ArtDesc: Specifies provisions for elections to the Legislative Assemblies in Union Territories.

Name: Special Provisions for Certain Union Territories
ArtDesc: Provides special provisions for certain Union Territories.

Name: Provisions for administration of Union Territories
ArtDesc: Specifies provisions for the administration of Union Territories.

Name: Transfer of Functions
ArtDesc: Allows for the transfer of functions from the Union to the States.

Name: Provisions for the Application of the Constitution
ArtDesc: Specifies provisions for applying the Constitution to Union Territories.

Name: Short Title of the Constitution
ArtDesc: Provides the short title of the Constitution.

Name: Commencement of the Constitution
ArtDesc: States the commencement date of the Constitution.

Name: Repeal of Certain Enactments
ArtDesc: Repeals certain enactments in the Constitution.

Name: Power to Make Provisions for the Constitution
ArtDesc: Empowers Parliament to make provisions for the Constitution.

Name: Interpretation of the Constitution
ArtDesc: States the rules for the interpretation of the Constitution.

Name: Amendment to the Constitution
ArtDesc: Outlines the procedure for amending the Constitution.

Name: State of Emergency
ArtDesc: Details the provisions related to a state of emergency.

Name: Special Provisions for Jammu and Kashmir
ArtDesc: Specifies special provisions for the State of Jammu and Kashmir.

Name: Special Provisions for Certain Areas
ArtDesc: Provides for special provisions for certain areas in the country.

Name: Provisions for the Administration of Certain Areas
ArtDesc: Specifies provisions for the administration of certain areas.

Name: Powers of the Legislature in Certain Areas
ArtDesc: Outlines the powers of the legislature concerning certain areas.

Name: Special Provision for Certain Classes
ArtDesc: Allows for special provisions for certain classes of people.

Name: Special Provisions for the Anglo-Indian Community
ArtDesc: Provides for special provisions for the Anglo-Indian community.

Name: Establishment of a Commission
ArtDesc: Empowers the establishment of a commission for specific purposes.

Name: Special Provisions for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
ArtDesc: Mandates special provisions for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.
